list-item.p: Climate change, carbon dioxide concentrations, and ozone pollution affect crop yields, leading to impacts that depend upon emission type
Impacts to date vary markedly across regions and crops, with large sensitivity of maize to methane and of tropical wheat to carbon dioxide
Crop yields over coming decades will be strongly influenced by changes in non‚ÄêCO 2 greenhouse gasses, ozone precursors, and aerosols
